website_summaries.verdict: A wooden pasta drying rack at a decent price, although some buyers found this option to be too flimsy.
pros: Has eight arms for hanging pasta
Breaks down quickly for easy storage
cons: Some reports of this rack arriving broken or breaking within a few uses

customer_reviews.title: Excellent and useful kitchen addition...
customer_reviews.text: I love making Pasta and this turned out to be a fantastic and USEFUL addition to my kitchen (unlike a lot of things stored in my cabinets that never see the light of day after 1 or 2 uses) It holds a lot of pasta and I really like that it folds back up and is compact to store. It doesn't take up much room, is very easy to clean and the price was reasonable considering how much use I've gotten out of it. You'll like it!
customer_reviews.author: KathleenTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Must have for homemade pasta.
customer_reviews.text: I would normally lay my pasta on a sheet and hope for the best. I had heard of a rack and did try the coat hanger method. For $12 I gave it a shot. Works perfectly. I love simple designs and this is just that. I oiled mine before assembly with butcher block cream. Keeping the box for storage upon disassembly. Holds enough fettuccine for 4.
customer_reviews.author: Lorianne Mayo

customer_reviews.title: A great, well-made and durable rack.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great drying rack overall, and especially for the price. It is easy to set up, ,clean and store back in the durable cardboard box it comes in. Also handy for holding fresh made and blanched lasagna sheets prior to assembling. Been using mine for a year now and I'm quite happy with it; now buying another as a gift. I use a bit of food grade mineral oil every few months to keep it nice, but no notice of any sort of chemical smell that others mentioned -- just natural wood. I recommend this over the more expensive and complicated models.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Post

customer_reviews.title: Very handy
customer_reviews.text: Worth it. I hated myself for buying something I could make in like 5 minutes, but since I was too lazy, this worked excellently. Making pasta without a rack to put it on would be hard. I imagine trying to flour it so it would not stick and then laying it out would affect the flavor and consistency. I just cut my pasta place it on the rack as I go, and then set it on top of the refrigerator until I am ready to use or toss it in a container in a couple days if I don't use it.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: The Perfect Pasta Drying Rack
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect pasta drying rack! It stores in a thin box that fits easily in a cabinet when not in use, and it doesn't take up too much space on a table or counter top while your pasta is drying. No complaints --highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Devin L.

customer_reviews.title: Does its job well.
customer_reviews.text: Let's start off by saying that this thing is huge. Or maybe I'm just small. Either way it expands like a young sapling when put together. Plenty of room for a standard batch of pasta. Easy to assemble. Easy to take apart. Haven't really cleaned it. Didn't realize it really needed cleaned. It's still pretty clean without me cleaning it and I've used it for about 7 lbs of pasta already.
customer_reviews.author: Alyssa

customer_reviews.title: Nice tree but the Wood smelled like mold
customer_reviews.text: I liked the product but couldn’t used it because it smelled so bad. My entire kitchen smelled like mold until I removed this pasta tree. I tried everything to try and rid the smell with no luck. I often read product reviews that stated a horrible smell. I thought that couldn’t be possible. It is. I can’t return it because I threw the box away. My next purchase will be a plastic pasta drying rack.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine P. Bliss

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive and functional
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to try making my own pasta but didn't want something super expensive in case I didn't enjoy it and this was the perfect option. It can collapse and not take up much space, but it's simple and functional compared to the fancy plastic "turbo" options that I imagine hipster foodies feeling the need to buy. To me, the simple wood is beautiful so even if your pasta sucks the stand looks like a sculpture on your counter while you cook. The one potential glitch I can see is if the wood swells in certain weather but so far that's not been an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Viola

customer_reviews.title: Terrible chemical smell
customer_reviews.text: I was so happy to receive my pasta drying rack until I opened the box. It had the worst chemical smell. I tried washing the rack and even tried to air it outside. After I brought it back in, I had to open all the windows to air the place out. Unfortunately, I will have to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer gardino

customer_reviews.title: Good wooden pasta rack
customer_reviews.text: This is an easy to use, assembling pasta rack made of wood. I was really set on finding a drying rack made of wood - this one fits the bill. The base and dowels come off easily so you can keep it in a drawer or in the box. I use the dowels to pick up the pasta from the machine and then slide it in the stand. You can also use another wooden rod of similar size to lay the pasta down on the tree. Either way, it works really well.
customer_reviews.author: Aidan McMurry

customer_reviews.title: Very handy and packs away easily
customer_reviews.text: In spite of a couple negative reviews I'm delighted with this simple and handy pasta rack. Yes, the hanging 'branches' slide in/out...but considering I can take it apart and store it away...that's fine with me. I've actually set up a 'Pasta Station' in my kitchen with two pasta machines, ravioli stamps, and this rack ready to go on a Chief's Cart!
customer_reviews.author: VSH

customer_reviews.title: Use it weekly in our home
customer_reviews.text: Simple, basic pasta drying rack. Easy asembly and disassembly. The kids typically set it up on pasta night. The youngest (3yrs) can assemble with no assistance. We store or in the box when not being used and keep in on the cookbook shelf on a small bakers rack. It's a long box due to the height of the dryer, however it stores easily in box slipped on top of the cookbooks. Would recommend. Great gift for anyone making their own pasta or who wants to try. If you don't have great wooden chairs to hang your noodles on the back of the way your amazing Italian grandma had... then go with the next basic thing.. the Norpro Pasta Drying Rack.
customer_reviews.author: theUncraftyMama

customer_reviews.title: Simple and Effective
customer_reviews.text: This was exactly what we were looking for, and exactly as I would design if I were to design one for myself. Super easy to assemble- just slide the dowels in. Pasta dries quickly due to the multiple levels. Quick to disassemble and store flat. We made the best fettuccine our first time! Bonus that it arrived next morning with Amazon Prime delivery!!
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Ok for small batches, have found a better option
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking to make one small batch of pasta, this may work for you; it will only dry a small batch of pasta. I don’t consider the drying rack easy to clean as you cannot put in the dishwasher. I prefer to put all products in the dishwasher on sanitize mode. Since I like to make large batches of pasta and freeze, I purchased a wooden clothes drying rack for drying my pasta. While I still can’t put in the dishwasher, I can dry a large amount of pasta. I simply place the drying rack on a large piece of butcher paper to avoid any mess.
customer_reviews.author: Doris E. Speer

customer_reviews.title: Strong odor on this product!
customer_reviews.text: This came with a strong odor, almost as if it had sat in a moldy storage area. I washed it, and still the odor is there. I had to throw it out before getting to use it, because even after I washed it, I could not stand the strong moldy odor that lingered on it.
customer_reviews.author: Laura H

customer_reviews.title: Folds down nicely. This isn't something you'll use a lot so ...
customer_reviews.text: Folds down nicely. This isn't something you'll use a lot so that matters quite a bit. Its sturdy enough, and we are still figuring it how to lay out the noodles since they seem to dry out and break everywhere they touch one of the sticks.
customer_reviews.author: justin phillips

customer_reviews.title: Would give 5 stars but......
customer_reviews.text: Sorry, haven't used yet. No time lately to make pasta. Will this Sunday. That being said, I have taken out of box, appears well made. Easily adjustable, sturdy. Just couldn't give 5 stars because I haven't gotten around to using yet, sorry, will this Sunday..
customer_reviews.author: pnlek5150

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Started making pasta at home and this little gadget is a must have for hassle free pasta making. Before when I laid the pasta down after cutting they would get tangled and stick together and this has eliminated that. Would recommend
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works Great, needed for homemade pasta people
customer_reviews.text: Made a bunch of pasta using this and it works well. The main dowel that screws into the base fits in nice and tight and keeps the whole thing sturdy. There is plenty of room for lots of pasta to dry on the smaller dowels that you slide into the main, vertical dowel. After, you just brush off any leftover flour, and put right back into the box.
customer_reviews.author: Michael M

customer_reviews.title: THIS PASTA DRYER has an odd moldy order
customer_reviews.text: While the pasta dryer was what I expected...BOTH the box and the wood have a musty moldy smell. (Similar to a wet basement). When I used it today my fresh pasta the other day, the fresh pasta dough absorbed the odor and I could taste it in the pasta after it was cooked. I tried washing it in warm soapy water but the smell is still in the wood. I am very disappointed because the one I had previously lasted for years and this was a replacement. I'm afraid I will have to throw it out. Will try to return a used pasta dryer.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Phelps

customer_reviews.title: Smells bad
customer_reviews.text: After taking it out of the box it smelled really bad. We tried to air it out but that didn’t help. I don’t want to put food on it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Forgettable
customer_reviews.text: It's not great. Not bad but a really entry-level offering. There are probably better pasta drying racks out there but I didn't want to invest too much. The wood dowels and threading system feel cheap. I am glad I will only use this once in a while/infrequently.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Mrozinski

customer_reviews.title: Nice Quality
customer_reviews.text: I used the pasta rack today for the first time and it is super easy to assemble. Some of the rods were kind of hard to push through the holes of the middle post. Overall very happy with the quality, would definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Randy

customer_reviews.title: Can't live without this for homemade noodles !
customer_reviews.text: Can't live without this when we make our homemade pasta !! This is a genius little creation, easy to store, easy to assemble, easy to clean. Love it. Stores right back in the box it came in.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great pasta rack
customer_reviews.text: Does what it's supposed to! It's a little annoying to put together cuz you have to thread the rods through the holes, but really that's only an issue for lazy people like me :) Love it and now I have some great dried fresh pasta for later
customer_reviews.author: cloud9

customer_reviews.title: Great for hanging pasta to dry.
customer_reviews.text: If you make your own linguini or spaghetti from scratch, it needs to be hung to dry a bit. This drying rack does the trick. It completely disassembles for storage, seems durable and holds a large amount of pasta. I like the fact that it is wood and not plastic. Highly Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: MadMax

customer_reviews.title: Not for me
customer_reviews.text: This rack is too small for my use, can only accommodate few bunch of noodles. Decided to just put the freezer directly because drying doesn’t do any difference for me.
customer_reviews.author: Romano

customer_reviews.title: Noodles at home
customer_reviews.text: The dowels need to be bigger and the whole thing taller.
customer_reviews.author: SB

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive pasta rack
customer_reviews.text: This is an inexpensive pasta rack and does its job. It doesn't hold a ton of pasta and I think that the poles could be longer. This is the only pasta rack I have owned so I cannot compare it to anything else but it's nothing special.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Z

customer_reviews.title: mold
customer_reviews.text: the drying rack smells like mold. I dried pasta on it and the pasta then tasted and smelled like mold. I have had it out of the packaging now for 5 days and the room the pasta rack is in also smells like mold so I will be moving it out into the garage for now. I used the manufacturer website to report this problem but that did not work either. I am very disappointed with the product and the customer service at this point.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Pasowicz

customer_reviews.title: not very stable and smelly
customer_reviews.text: The bolt is loose so the vertical piece cannot be secured firmly to the base. also the wood has a very strong smell which never wear off .
customer_reviews.author: Mario N.

customer_reviews.title: A little awkward
customer_reviews.text: I have several types and I use this one only with heavier pasta like Tagatelli or with egg noodles as the arms tend to move back and forth to easily
customer_reviews.author: Sandra R

customer_reviews.title: Not tough enough.
customer_reviews.text: It functions. I did need to repair it immediately after opening. The repair can't be seen or noticed. I do not feel that this rack will last with two young daughters helping me make noodles.
customer_reviews.author: WonderDog

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: Works great as long as you remember that as pasta dries it shrinks, so there will be breakage when removing from the rack.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Customer

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Again, I won’t know as the NorPro pasta machine was delivered broken!
customer_reviews.author: Marie Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t come apart
customer_reviews.text: The holes barely fit the wooden rods that hold the pasta. It took all my strength just to fit them in, and I’m not a frail weakling! I hit the gym 3 times per week and lift an admirable amount for a young man. The rods can’t be removed without breaking. I bought this item for its portability, which is totally lacking. I have to keep the rack on top of my fridge now because it won’t come apart. Poor design.
customer_reviews.author: Jake Nabasny

customer_reviews.title: It does the job
customer_reviews.text: The stand is fine, however it’s not the sturdiest stand I’ve ever owned. The price of it makes it acceptable, but I wouldn’t say I’m overly impressed.
customer_reviews.author: BRW

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy it
customer_reviews.text: Don’t buy it. I just cannot fit the sticks into the holes, no matter how hard I tried. And then I cannot take the sticks out of the holes... wish I can return it. I can’t put them back to the box since I cannot disassemble them. Too bad!
customer_reviews.author: Huijung

customer_reviews.title: It's a simple and easy to use rack
customer_reviews.text: There is not much to it, it simply does exactly what it is meant to do! Good value, easy to use!
customer_reviews.author: Tyson Peltz

customer_reviews.title: Cheap
customer_reviews.text: They said others bought this when I purchases my pasta maker ,should have brought the other one. Waste money
customer_reviews.author: Pammie

customer_reviews.title: Arrived Musty smelling
customer_reviews.text: This is the second time that I’ve got this product. This is a replacement. The first time it arrived it was warped and smelled musty. I returned it and ordered a replacement. The replacement arrived again smelling very musty. Cannot be used with food. I would advise everybody to stay clear of this product it’s going back
customer_reviews.author: Robert Manuel

customer_reviews.title: Handy pasta rack
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble. Attractive. Conservative of space. Stores easily after disassembled.
customer_reviews.author: jm

customer_reviews.title: Moldy smell makes it impossible to use!
customer_reviews.text: As soon as I opened the box I smelled the odor....I thought I would keep the item outside in the sun to try to remove the musty smell. It didn't work. The odor is so strong a guest mentioned it when he entered our kitchen! I will not be keeping this item! Can't imagine using it for food prep.
customer_reviews.author: Frances M.

customer_reviews.title: Stinks
customer_reviews.text: It smells like modpodge or some other chemical varnish. I've tried cleaning it. I've tried soaking it...which probably means I can't return it. It was a complete waste of money. I would never trust food to rest on it, because they would taste of the smell. The smell is obnoxious.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie and Chris Rohloff

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Definitely suits its purpose, pulls apart easily for cleaning and storage.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald A. Green

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for drying pasta. My grandchildren love using this. Quick delivery
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia Cusimano

customer_reviews.title: Sometimes the original ideas are still the best.
customer_reviews.text: Simple design that does the job and it's not plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Easy and Great
customer_reviews.text: Used it to dry our pepper fettuccine! It set up in under a minuet, and was a lot of space for noodles and worked well! Tear down was just as easy!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Too flimsy
customer_reviews.text: You are better off going to a woodshop and having it made for you.
customer_reviews.author: Gianni

customer_reviews.title: Glad I bought this
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to make my own pasta. It's very quick and easy to assemble and take apart, easy to store in it's own box. The noodles separate easily and dry quickly.
customer_reviews.author: stillerfan

customer_reviews.title: It's OK, but unstable, and kind of pointless.
customer_reviews.text: I thought it'd help, but really I find it gets more in the way than just laying it out. Sticks are too close together to really get pasta in there without doing it a few strands at a time (output from the KA spaghetti cutter is anything but one strand at a time...) Tt does kind of help when doing the sheets prior to cutting, allowing you to process all the pieces of dough to a given thickness before adjusting and running it through again, so in that sense, it's helpful...
customer_reviews.author: jenksdrummer

customer_reviews.title: Simply great
customer_reviews.text: I like how it disassembles to a compact size for storage. The quality of the wood is great.
customer_reviews.author: amzsteve

customer_reviews.title: It works for hanging pasta!
customer_reviews.text: It's a stick with a bunch of other sticks sticking out of it... What do you expect?
customer_reviews.author: G. Sparks

customer_reviews.title: Useful item
customer_reviews.text: I know lots of folks just throw their homemade pasta on floured towells but this neat little gadget is easier to clean up (actually I haven't found it needs any cleaning other than an occasional wipe down with a paper towell to remove excess flour.) I use it to hold my sheets of pasta in between rolling as well as the final cut product. It comes apart easily and stores right next to my pasta machine with the wooden base on top.
customer_reviews.author: K. S. Hall

customer_reviews.title: Decent beginner rack, but definitely not amazing.
customer_reviews.text: This does it's job at the very minimum. It seems very flimsy and has a hard time fitting under some even very tall cabinets. The build quality is poor but the price is decent for what you get. Would recommend buying a high priced set if you can afford it, otherwise this one will definitely do the job if you are looking for an entry level rack.
customer_reviews.author: WingoNation

customer_reviews.title: A must have for making pasta
customer_reviews.text: The amount of space it gives you to dry pasta is great! Plus it’s so easy to assemble and take apart— i just put it back in the box when I’m done.
customer_reviews.author: Laura B.

customer_reviews.title: Good basic pasta dryer
customer_reviews.text: It's a good basic pasta dryer. It's really just wooden dowels with holes drilled in them and a base, but it's sanded smooth and it works well. It's tall enough that I just left mine assembled and stuck it in the corner of my countertop where I had a basket anyway. The branches come out and it will dissemble if you want to do that too. I'm not sure what else to really say about it - it's about as basic as they come and it works.
customer_reviews.author: Bugs

customer_reviews.title: Good in its simplicity
customer_reviews.text: Does the job well, I bought 2 since one reviewer said it did not hold a lot of pasta, but i find that for my needs one is normally enough. Minus one star since the holes for the dowels are a little large and there is no real resistance, so I find myself often sliding the dowel as I place and rearrange the pasta on the dowel. Thought the base was a little wobbly, but then realized that I screwed it in reversed. LOL Its a nice accompianment to the KA KPRA rollers i bought.
customer_reviews.author: Tom W.

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: This was a Christmas gift along with a pasta maker. My daughter loves it and her family loves what comes off them. (I bought 2 of them)
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good drying but is too voluminous in design
customer_reviews.text: Good drying but is too voluminous in design. It needs to be de-assembled before storage and then re-assembled before the next use - in the end, not that practical
customer_reviews.author: cameliaTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Cheap feeling, but I guess it doesn't really matter
customer_reviews.text: This does what it's supposed to, I suppose, but it's awful cheap feeling. I feel like a kid made this with scrap balsa wood.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Wickersty

customer_reviews.title: Smelled like mold...couldn't use it
customer_reviews.text: When I opened the package the thing smelled so strongly of mold. I tried to wash it but it didn't work. I could use it for hanging pasta...sad.
customer_reviews.author: Tricia P

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Its a lightweight wooden rack that holds pasta, nothing special but the price was right!!! My only complaint is the pre-drilled holes where the other wooden dowels go through are not perfectly sized and some are tight while others are loose. Overall its a good product for the price and can easily be disassembled and stored.
customer_reviews.author: Alison D.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: Easy to setup. Not so easy to store. Sturdy enough for holding the pasta. Don't hesitate to get.
customer_reviews.author: Jarrod

customer_reviews.title: GREAT DRYING RACK
customer_reviews.text: This is good for drying pasta for a later use.
customer_reviews.author: Poohscorner74

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive and works wonderfully!
customer_reviews.text: This drying rack assembles easily and has sufficient room to dry a batch of pasta. It is such an improvement over trying to hang pasta over a collander or something to keep it from sticking! I disassemble mine and put it back in the box when I am not using it, to store it, as it is extremely bulky and awkward to store assembled. The assembly and disassembly is easy and quick. The price is reasonable. It does a wonderful job. This is definitely a great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Mom of Two

customer_reviews.title: A little flimsey
customer_reviews.text: When I put the first batch of pasta on the stand it tipped over. Then once the pasta dried it stuck to the wooden dowel arms
customer_reviews.author: J Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Dowels came bent
customer_reviews.text: We were excited to get this but were bummed when we opened to see the best wooden dowels. We decided to still use the rack since we needed it for pasta making the day it arrived, but quality control could be better.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Aumann

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful drying rack
customer_reviews.text: Simple to assemble and take apart. Works great for drying pasta. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: amazonreviewer

customer_reviews.title: Bad Smell
customer_reviews.text: It barely smells to me but my wife says it’s smells terrible. Most recent reviews in 2020 said the same thing but didn’t think wood could be made to smell bad so I bought it anyway. She put it in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Davis

customer_reviews.title: Simple and Effective
customer_reviews.text: Such a simple product that works so well. Dries freshly made pasta fast and keeps it from touching and sticking to each other. It is also very easy to store and doesn't take up much room. It comes apart in a few seconds as the wood dowels just site into drilled holes in the main wood support. The base also screws off the main dowel. Excellent, simple product.
customer_reviews.author: Retired Cop

customer_reviews.title: Disappointment may await the purchaser of this product.
customer_reviews.text: The drying sticks arrived mildewed. I soaked them in bleach and still have not got the mildew smell out of them. I am going to have to go to Home Depot and get some new sticks to make it functional. Other than that it is O.K. I purchased a ROMA pasta drying rack from Amazon and like it a lot better. In defense of the Norpro rack I will state that the center post is quite tall and lets you hang some long pasta, whereas, the Roma model is a little shorter.
customer_reviews.author: Bionic Tangerine

customer_reviews.title: Very useful putting all those strands of pasta somewher without having ...
customer_reviews.text: Very useful putting all those strands of pasta somewher without having to deluge them with flour and leave them in a pile
customer_reviews.author: Gerald

customer_reviews.title: Thank You
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome tool in our kitchen. Thank You for the availability!
customer_reviews.author: Tarea

customer_reviews.title: Very good product
customer_reviews.text: Every time I make homemade pasta I use it. Haven’t actually dried any pasta on it as of yet but it holds it until I’m ready to drop in the boiling water. Love the this product!!!
customer_reviews.author: Mareba archie

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: This works fine just have to watch length of pasta
customer_reviews.author: Tempe Lady

customer_reviews.title: OMG the SMELL is Horrible
customer_reviews.text: I should have listened to the reviews. The moldy smell is absolutely horrible. I can actually smell it from the other room it's so strong. Washing did not help. Such a waste of money. This should not be allowed to be sold on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: michogio

customer_reviews.title: Great for home made pasta drying.
customer_reviews.text: We just started making our own home made pasta, and this simple little stick and base system works great. When done, I just pull it quickly apart and toss the pieces in the plastic container I keep my pasta maker in. Quick to set up and take down, and takes up almost no space.
customer_reviews.author: med1pilot

customer_reviews.title: Leaning rack of pasta
customer_reviews.text: Simple design that was still somehow not built structurally sound. Asked for a return immediately. Cheaply made product even for the low price. This goes beyond the old addage of you get what you pay for. Definitely avoid this product.
customer_reviews.author: seth carver

customer_reviews.title: Rack smells like a damp basement!
customer_reviews.text: The box and its contents smell like they've been kept in a damp place. Will try to get the odor out of the rack; but if unsuccessful there is no way I will hang and dry fresh pasta on this item.
customer_reviews.author: Gram

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works great, just as advertised. Breaks down and stores easy.
customer_reviews.author: BT

customer_reviews.title: My daughter-in-law and son are having so much fun, making their own pasta
customer_reviews.text: This was a birthday present, along with a pasta maker. My daughter-in-law and son are having so much fun, making their own pasta, and drying it on this rack.
customer_reviews.author: M. Philipp

customer_reviews.title: Broke after second use
customer_reviews.text: The entire thing is held together with a nut that is wedged into a hole on the base. That nut became loose and fell out, now the pasta rack is unstable. Complete disaster, I will use it as fire wood now.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Simple is perfect!
customer_reviews.text: easy to assemble, clean and break down minimum storage space needed!
customer_reviews.author: dawnk0712

customer_reviews.title: Love it. Does what it is supposed to do...
customer_reviews.text: So my husband bought me pasta attachments for my KitchenAid mixer, and I needed a pasta drying rack to go along with it. This was reasonably priced and seemed like it would do the job of 'drying pasta'. I have used this 3 times in the past 2 weeks. It does its job. It is sturdy, and easy to put together. I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: MO

customer_reviews.title: Love that it comes apart for storage
customer_reviews.text: Practical size. Love that it comes apart for storage. Could not make fresh pasta without it.
customer_reviews.author: b

customer_reviews.title: This rack is just as great as the other reviews have said
customer_reviews.text: This rack is just as great as the other reviews have said. The height is just right for sheets of pasta before cutting, and works well for the cut noodles as well. Best of all, it stores flat!
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: Simple and easy to store. It works great.
customer_reviews.text: Serves its purpose with old time style. Easy to clean. No chemical smell. Love it. Easy to disassemble and store in a long drawer.
customer_reviews.author: Shelby12

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice price and nice rack! Easy to set up and nice looking! Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Kanes X. Huang

customer_reviews.title: Not the best
customer_reviews.text: Not the sturdiest drying rack but it still does the job.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Turner

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Product
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product and does exactly what we needed with pasta drying.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: Simple and does the job.
customer_reviews.text: It's a bunch of stick that you screw in and poke through a hole so you can dry pastas without them sticking to it, simple as that and does a great job of what it's suppose to do. Best part is that it's simple to assemble and disassemble when you are done.
customer_reviews.author: Chanchai Karouna

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and store
customer_reviews.text: Rack will hold spaghetti or linguini made from three or four cups of flour, which is about eight servings. I rubber-band the dowels together for storage. Not heavy duty, but certainly adequate for the job.
customer_reviews.author: ijoyl

customer_reviews.title: My noodle tree.
customer_reviews.text: My noodles dry quickly and without sticking together. The rack comes apart and stores in it's box on it's side in my cabinet. Comes out and goes together easily when I need it.
customer_reviews.author: Lori Blankenship

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect frame for pasta drying! Love the wood-made bars that keep pasta on them and not sliding or slipping off!
customer_reviews.author: Violet B. Steinert

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: I wish it came with a little pouch to store all of the pieces together. I am fearful of losing them. Other than that, it works great!
customer_reviews.author: Deana

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: This is very wobbly and doesn't assemble well. Seems like it should be easy peasy but the rods don't fit well into the hole. The center pole doesn't fit tightly into the base.
customer_reviews.author: La Vonne Mangin

customer_reviews.title: A must for drying your pasta!
customer_reviews.text: This came in very handy to dry lots of pasta.
customer_reviews.author: Pearly

customer_reviews.title: Recommend
customer_reviews.text: First time pasta maker and it was so very convenient
customer_reviews.author: LINDA

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: the rack is as advertised and not of very sturdy materials. But it only has to hang pasta....
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Norpro Pasta Drying Rack
product_meta.description:
Measures: 16.5" x 18" x 18" / 42cm x 45.5cm x 45.5cm. If you love making homemade pasta as much as we do, this is a definite must have! Our traditional wooden drying rack is perfect for drying fresh homemade pasta! The wooden rack stands 16 ½ inches tall, including a heavy, stable 7/8 inch thick base. Then equipped with 4 – 18 inch dowels that slide through the holes in the post, creating 8 arms that are perfectly angled so they don’t interfere with each other while drying pasta. Even the longest fettucine won’t touch the counter! Made of environmsrnt friendly Rubberwood, the unfinished wood is perfect for keeping the pasta strands from sliding off. Making homemade pasta will never be the same! Easy to use, easy to clean, easy to store, saves time and less mess! Disassembles in seconds for easy storage. To clean, simply wipe with a damp cloth. 

 Norpro was founded in 1973 with a vision to design, manufacture, and supply the highest caliber kitchenware. Norpro’s offering of innovative, high quality product for cooking, preparing and serving food are produced with superior materials and craftsmanship.



AMAZON.COM
Even the longest fresh fettuccine or linguine won't touch the counter when draped on the arms of this sturdy pasta drying rack. The rack stands 16-1/2 inches high, including a heavy, stable, 7/8-inch-thick base. Assembly (and disassembly for storage) is simple. The 3/4-inch center post screws into the base. Four 18-inch dowels then slide through holes in the post, providing eight arms--cunningly angled so they don't interfere with one another--on which to hang fresh pasta to dry before going into the pot, refrigerator, or freezer. As is traditional, the rack is made of unfinished wood so pasta strands don't slide off. --Fred Brack
feature_bullets: If you love making homemade pasta as much as we do, this is a definite must have! Our traditional wooden drying rack is perfect for drying fresh homemade pasta!

The wooden rack stands 16 ½ inches tall, including a heavy, stable 7/8 inch thick base. Then equipped with 4 – 18 inch dowels that slide through the holes in the post, creating 8 arms that are perfectly angled so they don’t interfere with each other while drying pasta. Even the longest fettucine won’t touch the counter!
Made of environmentally friendly Rubberwood, the unfinished wood is perfect for keeping the pasta strands from sliding off.
Disassembles in seconds for easy storage.
Making homemade pasta will never be the same! Easy to use, easy to clean, easy to store, saves time and less mess! To clean, simply wipe with a damp cloth.
